sen.j: 正親町三条実昭（おおぎまちさんじょう さねあき、寛永元年11月24日 (旧暦)（1625年1月3日）‐寛文8年5月7日 (旧暦)（1668年6月16日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Saneaki OGIMACHISANJO (January 3, 1625 - June 16, 1668) was a kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.
Saneaki OGIMACHISANJO (January 3, 1625 - June 16, 1668) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.
Saneaki OGIMACHISANJO (January 3, 1625 - June 16, 1668) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.

sen.j: おもに明正天皇（109代）・後光明天皇（110代）・後西天皇（111代）の三帝にわたり仕えた廷臣で、官位は従三位参議まで昇った。
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imerial Court who mainly served three emperors, Emperor Meisho (109th), Emperor Gokomyo (110th), and Emperor Gosai (111th), and rose to the official court rank of Jusanmi Sangi (councillor in the Junior Third Rank).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who mainly served three emperors, Empress Meisho (109th), Emperor Gokomyo (110th), and Emperor Gosai (111th), and was promoted to the official court rank of Jusanmi Sangi (Junior Third Rank, Councilor).
sen.cmt: 明正天皇は女帝です。Imerial -> Imperial rose -> was promoted
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who mainly served three emperors, Empress Meisho (109th), Emperor Gokomyo (110th), and Emperor Gosai (111th), and was promoted to the official court rank of Jusanmi Sangi (Junior Third Rank, Councilor).

sen.j: 父は大納言正親町三条実有。
sen.e: His father was Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO, Dainagon (a chief councillor of state).
His father was Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO, Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 大納言の補足説明を変更しました。
sen.e: His father was Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO, Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State).
His mother is unknown
His mother is unknown
His mother is unknown

sen.j: 兄に参議正親町三条公高がいる。
sen.e: His older brother was Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO, sangi (councillor).
His older brother was Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (Councilor).
His older brother was Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (Councilor).

sen.j: 室に近衛府冷泉為景の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Tamekage REIZEI, konoefu (a government official at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards in the Senior Fourth Rank).
His wife was a daughter of Tamekage REIZEI, a government official of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: in the Senior Fourth Rank -> 削除
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Tamekage REIZEI, a government official of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 子に参議正親町三条公廉、中納言正親町三条実久がいる。
sen.e: Among his sons were Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, sangi, and Sanehisa, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
One of his sons was Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi, and Sanehisa OGIMACHISANJO, Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 実久をフルネームにしました。
sen.e: One of his sons was Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi, and Sanehisa OGIMACHISANJO, Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State).
The first name he was given was Suenari.
He was firstly named Suenari.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was firstly named Suenari.
He was confeered a peerage in 1631.
He was confeered a peerage in 1631.
He was confeered a peerage in 1631.

sen.j: 刑部省をつとめていたが、慶安2年（1649年）、前年に薨去した兄公高の養子として正親町三条家を継ぐこととなった。
sen.e: He served at the Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice), however, in 1649, he inherited the Ogimachisanjo family as the adopted son of his older brother, Kintaka.
When he served at Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice), he succeeded to the Ogimachisanjo family in 1649 as the adopted son of his older brother, Kintaka, who died in the previous year.
sen.cmt: inherited -> succeeded to訳抜け：前年に薨去
sen.e: When he served at Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice), he succeeded to the Ogimachisanjo family in 1649 as the adopted son of his older brother, Kintaka, who died in the previous year.

sen.j: 近衛府・近衛府を経て、明暦元年（1655年）従三位参議となり、公卿に列するも同年中に辞職している。
sen.e: After being konoefu, he became Jusanmi Sangi (councillor in the Junior Third Rank) in 1655, position ranked with kugyo, however, he resigned in the same year.
sen.cmt: 近衛府が2度出てきていますが、訳は1つだけにしてあります。
sen.e: After he served as a government official at Konoefu, he became Jusanmi Sangi in 1655 and joined Kugyo, but he resigned in the same year.
sen.cmt: Webでは「右近衛少将・右近衛中将を経て」となっています。書き換える場合は下記です。After he served as Ukone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi Sangi in 1655 and joined Kugyo, but he resigned in the same year.
sen.e: After he served as a government official at Konoefu, he became Jusanmi Sangi in 1655 and joined Kugyo, but he resigned in the same year.

sen.j: その後寛文8年（1668年）に薨去。
sen.e: He died in 1668.
He died in 1668.
He died in 1668.
He was 45 years-old.
Died at the age of 45.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 45.
